If the transformation \\( g(z) \\) is applied to \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 and then it evolves by the governing equations without any further transformations, will the state of \\( z(T) \\) at T = T be the same as it would be by simply evolving \\( z_0 \\) under the original differential equations?
Explanation: The initial application of \\( g(z) \\) modifies the trajectory of \\( z(t) \\) due to the transformation \\( e^{Ct} \\), which affects the state differently than if \\( z_0 \\) were only subject to the natural evolution through \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\), hence the state \\( z(T) \\) will differ.
